brief_description: Introduction: Previous priming with avian influenza vaccines results in more rapid and more robust neutralizing antibody responses upon revaccination, but the role CD4+ T cells play in this process is not currently known.
brief_title: Effect of Influenza A (H5N1) Vaccine Prepandemic Priming on CD4+ T-Cell Responses
condition_studied: CD4+ T-cell response to Influenza A (H5N1) vaccine
description: Previous priming with avian influenza vaccines results in more rapid and more robust neutralizing antibody responses upon revaccination, but the role CD4+ T cells play in this process is not currently known.
endpoints: Pre- and post-vaccination CD4+ T-cell reactivity has been compared using IFN-g cytokine enzyme-linked immunosorbent spot assays with pools of overlapping synthetic peptides as recall antigen.  The neutralizing antibody response to rgA/Indonesia/05/2005 PR8-IBCDC-RG2 virus has been measured by microneutralization assay.
hypothesis: The specificity of CD4+ T cells influences their ability to help B cells during infection or vaccination.
intervention_agent: Inactivated monovalent subvirion influenza A/H5N1/Indonesia/05/05 (clade 2) vaccine
objectives: To evaluate how pre- and post-vaccination CD4 T cell responses impact the specificity and magnitude of the antibody response to H5 vaccination.
official_title: Effect of Influenza A (H5N1) Vaccine Prepandemic Priming on CD4+ T-Cell Responses

arm.description: Unprimed healthy adults with no history of H5 vaccination who were not at risk for H5 exposure. Received a prime-boost regimen of influenza A/Indonesia/5/05 vaccine consisting of 2 identical 15ug dose vaccinations separated by 28 days.
arm.name: Unprimed_15ugdose

arm.description: Unprimed healthy adults with no history of H5 vaccination who were not at risk for H5 exposure. Received a prime-boost regimen of influenza A/Indonesia/5/05 vaccine consisting of 2 identical 90ug dose vaccinations separated by 28 days.
arm.name: Unprimed_90ugdose

arm.description: Subjects have previously received either egg-derived inactivated subvirion influenza A/Vietnam/1203/2004 vaccine (clade 1) with HA doses of 3.75-90 ?g in 2005-2006, or 2 doses of baculovirus-expressed recombinant influenza A/HongKong/156/1997 (clade 0) H5 protein in 1997-1998, followed by a single dose of unadjuvanted inactivated subvirion influenza A/Vietnam/1203/04 in 2006. This group received a single 15ug dose of influenza A/Indonesia/5/05 vaccine.
arm.name: Primed_15ugdose

arm.description: Subjects have previously received either egg-derived inactivated subvirion influenza A/Vietnam/1203/2004 vaccine (clade 1) with HA doses of 3.75-90 ?g in 2005-2006, or 2 doses of baculovirus-expressed recombinant influenza A/HongKong/156/1997 (clade 0) H5 protein in 1997-1998, followed by a single dose of unadjuvanted inactivated subvirion influenza A/Vietnam/1203/04 in 2006. This group received a single 90ug dose of influenza A/Indonesia/5/05 vaccine.
arm.name: Primed_90ugdose

pubmed.title: Effect of influenza A(H5N1) vaccine prepandemic priming on CD4+ T-cell responses.

program.program_name: NIAID Centers of Excellence for Influenza Research and Surveillance (CEIRS)
program.contract_name: New York Influenza Center of Excellence
